ETYMOLOGY: Coined in the early 20th century in the U.S., referring to the T-shape of the garment when laid flat. It evolved from undergarments worn by soldiers and sailors in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A type of casual shirt, typically collarless, short-sleeved, and made of a stretchy fabric like cotton, with a shape resembling the letter T.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种休闲上衣，通常无领、短袖，由棉等有弹性的面料制成，形状像字母T。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He often wears a simple black t-shirt and jeans when he's off duty.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他下班时经常穿一件简单的黑色T恤和牛仔裤。
